sentences.english: The ship had vanished without trace.
She a heart deceive I am this stuff, should merely I don't know, this equitable runs without a track.
sentences.chinese: 她一心瞞着我此事，只當我不知，這才跑的無影無蹤。

sentences.english: It disappeared without a trace, like fine red wine in crystal.
sentences.chinese: 牠消失得無影無蹤，就好像水晶杯裏酡紅的紅酒。

sentences.english: It vaporises, within a second as though it had never existed.
sentences.chinese: 彷彿從來不曾存在，瞬間便蒸發消散，無影無蹤。

sentences.english: Great names such as Pan Am had disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 許多偉大的名字，像泛美航空，早已消失的無影無蹤。

sentences.english: No vestige of Hat Island is left now.
sentences.chinese: 帽兒島現在已經無影無蹤了。

sentences.english: The animals have fled.Ash blows on the wind.
sentences.chinese: 動物們已逃得無影無蹤，只剩下灰燼在風中飄揚。

sentences.english: The sound of a bird vanished into thin air.
sentences.chinese: 那清脆的鳥叫聲消失得無影無蹤。

sentences.english: Compared with loss of thee, will not seem so.
sentences.chinese: 比起喪失你來便要無影無蹤。

sentences.english: Before I could say " knife", the boy who had broken the window was gone.
sentences.chinese: 打爛了窗戶的那個男孩轉瞬間已逃得無影無蹤。

sentences.english: After several hours, the lesion will be nothing more than a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 幾小時後，損傷就會無影無蹤。

sentences.english: Then, taking the money, the thief turned and got clear away swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 這時，騙子帶着錢袋，轉身一溜煙地逃得無影無蹤。

sentences.english: Let them be washed away by the cleansing waters, and let them go.
sentences.chinese: 讓它們被淨化水沖走吧，讓它們消失得無影無蹤。

sentences.english: When I turned back, the little boy had vanished into thin air.
sentences.chinese: 當我轉回身時，那個小男孩已經消失得無影無蹤了。

definition: wordless and uncommunicative (idiom); without speaking/taciturn/not providing any news
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
the sky spins, the earth goes round (idiom); giddy with one's head spinning/fig. huge changes in the world
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
